p: In Australia, parthenium weed occurs as two notable biotypes which differ with respect to their geographic location, introduction history, invasive ability and spread [ 2]. The first introduction occurred in the mid-1940s in Toogoolawah (southeast Queensland) and has not spread far from its point of introduction; it is now referred to as the Toogoolawah biotype. The second introduction occurred in 1958 in Clermont (central Queensland); this population has since spread widely across central and southern Queensland and is known as the Clermont biotype [ 2].
